gameMaster

Class GameMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMaster.GameMaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameManagerObservor

    public class GameMaster
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameManagerObservor

      • GameMaster

        public GameMaster(int numberOfHumans,
                  int numberOfAIs,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tankScripts,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sniperScripts,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> scoutScripts,
                  int boardSize)
        Parameters:
        numberOfHumans - The total number of Humans
        numberOfAIs - The total number of AIs
        tankScripts - ArrayList of tanksScripts from robotSelection menu
        sniperScripts - ArrayList of sniperScripts from robotSelection menu
        scoutScripts - ArrayList of scoutScripts from robotSelection menu
        boardSize - : size of the board

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfGameOver

        public boolean checkIfGameOver()
        Check if the game is over/or there is a winner. This is called at the end of every turn to see if there's a last Player standing.
        Returns:
        True if the game is over, False otherwise

      • updateDisplay

        public void updateDisplay()
        updates the display to have a new board
        Specified by:

        public void mouseClicked(int x,
                         int y)
        This is called when a user clicks on the GameBoard. It calls myGameManager fire at the tile clicked
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface GameManagerObservor
        Parameters:
        x - the pixel x position
        y - the pixel y position

        Parameters:

      • handleKeyEvent

        public void handleKeyEvent(char key)
        Description copied from interface: GameManagerObservor
        Inform the GameMaster that the key 'key' was pressed, and handle it appropriately. 'a' and 'd' turn right and left, 'w' moves a tile forward, and 'n' moves to the next Player's turn.
        Specified by:
        handleKeyEvent in interface GameManagerObservor
        Parameters:
        key - the letter which was pressed

      • updateTileAfterMove

        public void updateTileAfterMove(Unit currUnit)
        Description copied from interface: GameManagerObservor
        Update the tile from which the Unit currUnit is moving
        Specified by:
        updateTileAfterMove in interface GameManagerObservor
        Parameters:
        currUnit - Unit whose tiles needs to be updated

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn()
        Description copied from interface: GameManagerObservor
        End the turn of the current player and move to the next turn
        Specified by:
        endTurn in interface GameManagerObservor

      • findWinner

        private int findWinner()
        Find the winner of the game. Get the number of the player who won. If no player won, return -1.
        Returns:
        -1 if there was a draw, and the number of the winning player otherwise.

      • endGame

        private void endGame()
        End the game by finding the winner and asking the display to represent the game being over.

      • isHumanTurn

        private boolean isHumanTurn(int player)
        Checks to see if the current Player is human or not.
        Parameters:
        player - confirm if the player is human or not
        Returns:
        True if the current Player is human, false otherwise.

      • getNextPlayerTurn

        private int getNextPlayerTurn()
        Get the integer representing the next player's turn.
        Returns:
        integer representation of next player

      • nextTurn

        private void nextTurn()
        Proceed to the next play in the game. If the current Player is human, process a Human player's turn. If they are a CPU, process a CPU's turn.

      • getPlayerColour

        private java.awt.Color getPlayerColour(int player)
        Get the colour of the a player.
        Parameters:
        player - : number of players
        Returns:
        The color if 'player'

      • round

        private void round()
        Check and process round numbers. If we are at the end of a round, advance the round. If we are at the end of a turn, reset the round.

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(ForthString destType,
                           Value payLoad)
        Description copied from interface: GameManagerObservor
        Send a message consisting of the value 'payLoad' from the current Unit to the Unit on the current Unit's team of type destType.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
